models.Name: Random Forest
models.General Description: An ensemble learning method that constructs multiple decision trees and merges them for improved accuracy and stability.
models.Methodology: Uses bagging (Bootstrap Aggregating) to train multiple decision trees on different subsets of the data and aggregates their predictions by majority voting (classification) or averaging (regression).
models.Best Applications: Tabular data, fraud detection, feature importance analysis, and medical diagnosis.

models.Name: Logistic Regression
models.General Description: A statistical model that applies a logistic function to model binary or multi-class classification problems.
models.Methodology: Uses a sigmoid function to estimate probabilities, with coefficients optimized via Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE).
models.Best Applications: Binary classification tasks, credit scoring, medical diagnosis, and spam detection.

models.Name: Linear Regression
models.General Description: A fundamental regression model that establishes a linear relationship between dependent and independent variables.
models.Methodology: Minimizes the sum of squared residuals to determine the best-fit line for predicting continuous target variables.
models.Best Applications: House price prediction, economic forecasting, and risk assessment.

models.Name: Support Vector Machine (SVM)
models.General Description: A supervised learning model that uses a hyperplane to separate data points into different classes.
models.Methodology: Finds the optimal hyperplane that maximizes the margin between different classes using kernel functions for non-linear data.
models.Best Applications: Text classification, image recognition, and bioinformatics.

models.Name: Artificial Neural Network (ANN)
models.General Description: A deep learning model inspired by the human brain, consisting of interconnected layers of neurons that process data.
models.Methodology: Uses backpropagation and gradient descent to adjust weights in hidden layers to minimize loss.
models.Best Applications: Image classification, speech recognition, and complex pattern recognition.

models.Name: Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM)
models.General Description: A type of recurrent neural network (RNN) designed to capture long-term dependencies in sequential data.
models.Methodology: Uses specialized memory cells with gates to control the flow of information, reducing the vanishing gradient problem.
models.Best Applications: Time series forecasting, natural language processing, and speech recognition.

models.Name: Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU)
models.General Description: A simplified version of LSTM that uses gating mechanisms to capture dependencies in sequential data.
models.Methodology: Employs update and reset gates to regulate information flow and reduce computational complexity.
models.Best Applications: Chatbots, stock price prediction, and machine translation.
